page.title: 02St.Michael's Church,Pitsea.
page.content: I think the church is the most important building in the area.The church has a tower which is 16th century.The church is mainly made of large and small grey bricks and most of the church was rebuilt in 1871.Now the church is locked and no services are held.Basildon council have the keys and want to turn it into a museum. There is a legend that a purple monk hung himself and if you run around the church 3 times backwards he will appear.Some people also think the church is haunted by a headless nun. Local people call it the"Church on the hill",because it is on a hill and it has lovely views.The church has been vandalised and several of the windows are broken,but plants surround the church and ivy grows around part of the church. By Kirsty Whitelaw.{
